revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Ugoos |model=UM4 |revision= |asin= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |fcc_date=09/27/2017 |fcc_id=2AL8YUM4 |type=media streamer |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Rockchip |cpu1_model=RK3328 |cpu1_cspeed=1.5 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=16 GiB |ram1=2 GiB |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 (OTG), USB 3.0, |expansion_usb_num=3 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |flags=HDMI out, AV out, IR receiver, SD Card slot |stock_os=Linux;Android;7.1; |802dot11_protocols=bgn }} {{TagLine|Android TV Dongle}} :{{ProductPage|http://ugoos.net/ugoos-um4-rk3328-hdr-cec-ddr4-dongle}}
The Model Difference document at the FCC says, :Model: UM3, UM4, UM5, 4x4H60 :All the models are the same circuit and RF module, except the mode names.
Product page claims 5.8GHz "802.11ac" support but that's not covered in the FCC entry.
===See also=== :[http://ugoos.net/ugoos-brand Ugoos Brand Product] *[[Ugoos AM1]] - CPU: [[Amlogic]] S905, GPU: Mali-450MP, RAM: 2GB, Flash: 16GB :Ports: 1x GbE, 3x USB 2.0, HDMI 2.0, SPDIF, SD Card; OS: Android 5.1 *[[Ugoos UM2]] - CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3188, GPU: Mali-400, RAM: 2GB, Flash: 8/16GB :Ports: 1x GbE, 3x USB 2.0, HDMI 2.0, SPDIF, SD Card; OS: Android 4.2 <!--4x 1.6GHz --> *[[Ugoos UT3S]] - CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3288, GPU: Mali-T764, RAM: 2GB, Flash: 16GB :Ports: 1x GbE, 4x USB 2.0, HDMI 2.0, SPDIF, AV, SD Card; OS: Android 4.4 <!-- CPU: 4x 1.8GHz, WiFi: 2.4/5GHz 802.11ac, BT 4.0 --> *[[Ugoos UG007B]] - CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3188, GPU: Mali-400, RAM: 2GB, Flash: 8GB :Ports: 3x USB 2.0, HDMI 1.3, SD Card; OS: Android 4.2; [[AMPAK AP6210]] BT 4.0 <!--4x 1.4GHz --> :Ugoos UG007 - [[Rockchip]] RK3066, [[MediaTek]] MT5931/MT6622 (BT 2.1) *[[Ugoos UG802B]] - [[Rockchip]] RK3188, [[Broadcom]] BCM4330 [[AMPAK AP6330]] BT 4.0 :Ugoos UG802 - [[Rockchip]] RK3066, [[Realtek]] RTL8188EUS :Ugoos QC802 - [[Rockchip]] RK3188, [[MTK]]/[[AMPAK]] â€¢ CDT-K25931
